data.title: Standalone Help Documentation
data.body:
The in editor Godot documentation is a the most up-to date resource for GDScript, given one has the newest build. 

Since Godot binaries are essentially an autoloading Godot image without the developer tools, it might be possible to extract the help documentation window as a standalone application.

This would be an important feature, as the help documentation is necessary and invaluable for learning to program in Godot, and it is useful to have a separate window apart from the project one is editing.

data.title: Fix Tree checkbox check/uncheck behavior
data.body: I noticed that when i press enter with a Tree checkbox selected it don't check/uncheck.

data.title: Small PopupMenu behaviour changes
data.body:
These are the three changes I propose:
- Do not hide the menu when clicking a separator or a disabled item. It is annoying if the user clicked it accidentally instead of the item above/below.
- Disable highlight when hovering a separator or a disabled item. Currently it keeps the last hovered item highlighted, which may make the user think he is still hovering it.
  ![screen](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7718100/10970460/0fe93c40-83cf-11e5-8322-ebbff245a7cf.png)
- ~~Reset the current hover item to none when clearing the menu.~~

data.title: ProgressBar percentage visibility in editor parameters
data.body: Currently there is no option to change the visibility of the percentage from the editor. The only way to do that is via code. It would be nice to have that option in the inspector

data.title: expand/collapse code chunks in script editor
data.body: It might be useful to be able to expand/collapse code branches by editor.

data.title: Console error: "ERROR: get_edited_scene_root"
data.body:
Getting the following error on the latest master: dde6396f221672d34d178c75f4080c1e87612aea.

```
ERROR: get_edited_scene_root: Index current_edited_scene out of size (edited_scene.size()).
   At: tools/editor/editor_data.cpp:500.
```

See issue #2611 which ended up being unrelated but has details on some findings on the error.  I've copied the findings here:

https://github.com/okamstudio/godot/blob/master/tools/editor/property_editor.cpp#L2355

In `property_editor.cpp`, it's calling `get_edited_scene()`which is defined straight in the `editor_node.h` file inline.  This then calls `get_edited_scene_root()` resulting in the error message.  I think that call to `get_edited_scene()` on that line in `property_editor.cpp` needs an additional check?  Or maybe `PropertyEditor::update_tree()` needs to be called later on in some initialization setup?

This commit fixes the error message about `get_edited_scene_root`, but I haven't really tested it.

https://github.com/firefly2442/godot/commit/2b4d089564496354cde4cc751e3fa846e5a4c8ff

I didn't create a pull request yet because I wanted to get some input from you folks about it.  Should the check for a valid scene node be done here or someplace else?  It's just returning NULL which may not be a good solution.  Thoughts?

data.title: Fix Range exp_edit property
data.body: Small fix that change the Range exp_edit property from real to bool.

data.title: add multiline comments
data.body:
''' does not work
generate "Unexpected token: Constant" error

data.title: RegEx class documented.
data.body: RegEx class has been documented. In the future I'd like to alter (again) the help viewer to show descriptions for the methd's parameters.

data.title: Fixed broken set_loop_restart_time method in AudioStreamPlaybackOGGVorbis
data.body: Just noticed this did nothing.

data.title: Line edit alignment
data.body: Added the ability to set text alignment for LineEdit control for aesthetic purposes.

data.title: Disable baked lighting sampling on shadeless materials.
data.body: Self-explanatory, simply makes it so shadeless materials don't sample baked lighting.

data.title: New 'get_position_distance' method for camera.
data.body: Simple method to allow you to get the exact distance from the camera. I'm using this for 3D-to-2D GUI trickery.

data.title: Experimental retooling of AnimationTreePlayer to allow manual advancement
data.body: This change to the AnimationTreePlayer allows you to directly control the number of frames the animation will advance as an alternative to just setting it to 'play'. I believe the standard AnimationPlayer already allows you to do this. The specific reason you would want such a feature is for combining procedural and physics-based animation with fixed skeletal animation, since by controlling the exact moment when the animation advances, skeletal animation can coexist directly alongside the physics simulation, which is nessecary because otherwise it doesn't work as you'd expect.

data.title: BoneAttachment fix.
data.body: This just makes bone attachments work as I imagine they're expected to, it simply removes the inverse rest matrix from the equation so the attachment's spatial position follows the attached bone exactly.

data.title: Canvas Clipping fix
data.body: There is a bug when doing canvas clipping inside viewports where they will clip relative to the size of the screen rather than the viewport. In my specific case, I have a viewport which I use to draw a GUI onto a texture. I later discovered that this fix also broke clipping in the editor viewport, so the workaround I presented was to check if the viewport had a rendertarget or not, but I'm not sure if this is universally ideal.

data.title: Fixed Audio System Crash
data.body: Moved deleting sample player in OS finalize methods to before deleting audio server to prevent crash when exiting. This bug seemed to only affect a notools build.

data.title: Ignore alpha materials in baked light ray-tracer.
data.body: Allows the offline raytracer to pass through transluscent materials, useful for glass windows, ect. Currently translucent materials do not affect the ray, but I may attempt to enhance this further in future.

data.title: Added missing saving support to animation editor.
data.body: Due to recent changes in the resource system, there is currently no way to save animations from the animation editor, so I added a custom way of doing it directly from the animation editor itself. I'm not sure if this is the best way to solve this problem, but it should at least work now. A similar issue still exists in the script editor.

data.title: Write to 4-dimensional position access and shader graph code generation fix.
data.body: I added the ability to write to the 4-dimensional position vector in custom vertex shader code since I needed direct access for a shader I'm working on. While I was at it, I fixed some code generation bugs concerning converting xforms to vectors and vice versa in the shader graph. Also changed mode_replace_table entries to use enums rather than numbers to prevent potential mistakes.

data.title: Various fixes and small features
data.body: Sorry for the delay on this. Here's a cherry-picked branch containing some fairly minor bugfixes and small features which I hope you wouldn't mind including. I'll be sending more soon.

data.title: RigidBodys randomly instanced sleeping on Android
data.body:
I move my zombies and bullets with set_linear_velocity(). On PC this works perfectly. On my Android phone however, about 1/4 of both object types just are not affected by set_linear_velocity() at all.
The zombies just stay where they are and the bullets just drop to the ground. 
Even though I can see in the log that set_linear_velocity() is called on them all the time.

Has anyone experienced something similar? How are physics done differently on Android?

Edit 1: I just tried apply_impulse() instead of set_linear_velocity(). The problem stays the same.

Edit 2: I tried with 2.0 ALPHA instead of my 1.1 custom build. The problem still exists, but it's now only about 1/15 of objects that are not touched by physics.

data.title: Update all demo resources to 2.0 format
data.body: As the title says. Currently some demos are still using pre-1.0 formats (see e.g. #451).

data.title: Fix arguments parsing in the main function
data.body:
Fixes #2611 which was a regression from 692216b86ab97db91e7ff3903ffc9ac8e37433f6.
The bogus behaviour considered that if there were more than one arguments left to parse,
they would be a pair of arguments (switch and its parameter), and thus skipped the next
argument in all cases (thus potentially skipping a "-editor", which triggered #2611).

This is fixed by checking first for arguments that don't expect a parameter, and only
afterwards for arguments that expect a parameter. And if a "pair" of arguments is not
valid, we no longer increment the counter.

data.title: Overlapped Nodes do not emit mouse_exit signal
data.body:
When two Texture buttons are next to each other and overlap slightly, then the mouse exit signal will not be emitted when the mouse moves from the button that is partially covered to the button on top. 
 The same happens for Area2D when it is overlapped by a control node (Area2D does not emit mouse_exit signal when mouse moves from area2d to control node on top of it).  Both times the mouse exit signal is only emitted when the mouse finally leaves the top level control node.
Tested in 1.1 stable and 2.0 alpha 30.10.2015

data.title: Fix default StyleBoxes of MenuButton
data.body:
The focus mode of MenuButton nodes is by default set to `FOCUS_NONE`. However, when the focus mode is changed, MenuButton falls back to the ERROR texture, since the `focus` StyleBox is not set in the default theme.
This happens in some MenuButton instances in the editor, such as the animation player "Tracks" button (see #729).

This change adds the `sb_button_focus` StyleBox for MenuButton. I think this looks alright, but a designer (@ndee85?) might want to take a look at it. In any case, this gets rid of the ugly ERROR texture.

Fixes #729.

data.title: Text Editor theme not all Basic Types are affected by colouring
data.body:
In Text Edit settings there is option to change color for Basic Types. It works for Vector, Matrix, Transform, Plane, Quat, InputEvent and Color types.
Other base types like String, NodePath, IntArray and so on are not affected.

Well also int/float numeric values are not affected but they probably need their own color setting.

data.title: Cosmetic fixes to SCons buildsystem
data.body:
- Removed trailing spaces
- Made sure all indentation is done using tabs (fixes #39)
